Message.Issue: Implement IDisposable on 'Animation' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'Timer'. If 'Animation' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.

Implement IDisposable on 'Audio' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'SoundPlayer'. If 'Audio' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.

'Sprite.Sprite()' contains a call chain that results in a call to a virtual method defined by the class. Review the following call stack for unintended consequences:
Sprite..ctor() Sprite.Init():Void

'Sprite.Sprite()' contains a call chain that results in a call to a virtual method defined by the class. Review the following call stack for unintended consequences:
Sprite..ctor() Sprite.Init():Void Sprite.set_Location(Point):Void

Sprite..ctor() Sprite.Init():Void Sprite.set_Opacity(Single):Void

Implement IDisposable on 'TextSprite' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'Bitmap', 'StringFormat'. If 'TextSprite' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.

Rule.Name: Do not call overridable methods in constructors
Rule.Description: Virtual methods defined on the class should not be called from constructors. If a derived class has overridden the method, the derived class version will be called (before the derived class constructor is called).
Rule.Resolution: {0} contains a call chain that results in a call to a virtual method defined by the class. Review the following call stack for unintended consequences: {1}

Rule.Name: Types that own disposable fields should be disposable
Rule.Description: Types that declare disposable members should also implement IDisposable. If the type does not own any unmanaged resources, do not implement a finalizer on it.
Rule.Resolution: Implement IDisposable on {0} because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: {1}. If {0} has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.
